jade.core
Class World

java.lang.Object
  jade.core.Messenger
      jade.core.World

public abstract class World
extends Messenger

Represents a game world on which Actor can interact.

Constructor Summary

          Constructs a new World with the given dimensions.

World

public World(int width,
             int height)
Constructs a new World with the given dimensions. Both width and height must be positive integers.

Parameters:
width - the width of the new World
height - the height of the new World

public final void addActor(Actor actor)

                           Dice dice)
Adds an Actor to the World at a random open tile, as generated by the specified Dice with a call to getOpenTile()/

Parameters:
actor - the Actor to be added
dice - the random number generator used to find the open tile

                     int x,

getActor

public <T extends Actor> T getActor(java.lang.Class<T> cls)
Returns an Actor of the given class, regardless of the location on the World , or null if there is none. If there are multiple possible Actor that could be returned, an arbitrary Actor is returned.

Type Parameters:
T - the generic type of the class to be returned
Parameters:
cls - the Class<T extends Actor> of the Actor to be returned
Returns:
an Actor of the given class

getActorAt

public final <T extends Actor> T getActorAt(java.lang.Class<T> cls,
                                            Coordinate pos)
Returns an Actor of the given class at the given location, or null if there is none. If there are multiple possible Actor that could be returned, an arbitrary Actor is returned.

Type Parameters:
T - the generic type of the class to be returned
Parameters:
cls - the Class<T extends Actor> of the Actor to be returned
pos - the location being queried
Returns:
an Actor of the given class located at (x, y)

getActorAt

public <T extends Actor> T getActorAt(java.lang.Class<T> cls,
                                      int x,
                                      int y)
Returns an Actor of the given class located at (x, y), or null if there is none. If there are multiple possible Actor that could be returned, an arbitrary Actor is returned.

Type Parameters:
T - the generic type of the class to be returned
Parameters:
cls - the Class<T extends Actor> of the Actor to be returned
x - the x location being queried
y - the y location being queried
Returns:
an Actor of the given class located at (x, y)

getActOrder

public java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends Actor>> getActOrder()
Returns the act order for the World. This list will affect the tick() method by changing the priority with which Actors will act. Note that if one class in the draw order is a superclass of another in the list, any Actor of the type of the subclass will act twice in the tick() method.

Returns:
the act order for the World

getActors

public <T extends Actor> java.util.Collection<T> getActors(java.lang.Class<T> cls)
Returns a Collection<T extends Actor> of all Actor of the given class, Regardless of their location on the World.

Type Parameters:
T - the generic type of the class to be returned
Parameters:
cls - the Class<T extends Actor> of the Actor to be returned
Returns:
a Collection<T extends Actor> of all Actor of the given class

                                                                   Coordinate pos)

Parameters:

getDrawOrder

public java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends Actor>> getDrawOrder()
Returns the draw order for the World. This list will affect the lookAll() method by changing the priority with which Actors will be drawn. Note that if one class in the draw order is a superclass of another in the list, any Actor of the type of the subclass will be seen twice in the lookAll() method.

Returns:
the draw order for the World

getOpenTile

public final Coordinate getOpenTile()
Gets a randomly chosen open tile from anywhere on the World. The global instance of Dice is used as the default parameter for randomly choosing the tiles. If after 100 randomly selected tiles are closed, then each tile will be checked and the first open tile found is returned. If the entire World is closed, null is returned.

Returns:
a randomly chosen open tile

getOpenTile

public final Coordinate getOpenTile(Coordinate topLeft,
                                    Coordinate bottomRight)
Gets a randomly chosen open tile on the World within the given bounds. The global instance of Dice is used as the default parameter for randomly choosing the tiles. If after 100 randomly selected tiles are closed, then each tile will be checked and the first open tile found is returned. If the entire World is closed, null is returned.

Parameters:
topLeft - the bounds upper-left most value
bottomRight - the bounds bottom-right most value
Returns:
a randomly chosen open tile

getOpenTile

public final Coordinate getOpenTile(Dice dice)
Gets a randomly chosen open tile from anywhere on the World. If after 100 randomly selected tiles are closed, then each tile will be checked and the first open tile found is returned. If the entire World is closed, null is returned.

Parameters:
dice - the random number generator used to randomly select tiles
Returns:
a randomly chosen open tile

getOpenTile

public final Coordinate getOpenTile(Dice dice,
                                    Coordinate topLeft,
                                    Coordinate bottomRight)
Gets a randomly chosen open tile on the World within the given bounds. If after 100 randomly selected tiles are closed, then each tile will be checked and the first open tile found is returned. If the entire World is closed, null is returned.

Parameters:
dice - the random number generator used to randomly select tiles
topLeft - the bounds upper-left most value
bottomRight - the bounds bottom-right most value
Returns:
a randomly chosen open tile

getOpenTile

public Coordinate getOpenTile(Dice dice,
                              int x1,
                              int y1,
                              int x2,
                              int y2)
Gets a randomly chosen open tile on the World within the given bounds. If after 100 randomly selected tiles are closed, then each tile will be checked and the first open tile found is returned. If the entire World is closed, null is returned.

Parameters:
dice - the random number generator used to randomly select tiles
x1 - the bounds left most value
y1 - the bounds upper most value
x2 - the bounds right most value
y2 - the bounds bottom most value
Returns:
a randomly chosen open tile

getOpenTile

public final Coordinate getOpenTile(int x1,
                                    int y1,
                                    int x2,
                                    int y2)
Gets a randomly chosen open tile on the World within the given bounds. The global instance of Dice is used as the default parameter for randomly choosing the tiles. If after 100 randomly selected tiles are closed, then each tile will be checked and the first open tile found is returned. If the entire World is closed, null is returned.

Parameters:
x1 - the bounds left most value
y1 - the bounds upper most value
x2 - the bounds right most value
y2 - the bounds bottom most value
Returns:
a randomly chosen open tile

look

public final ColoredChar look(Coordinate pos)
Returns the face that should be drawn for the given location.

Parameters:
pos - the location being queried
Returns:
the face that should be drawn for the given location.

look

public final ColoredChar look(int x,
                              int y)
Returns the face that should be drawn for the given location. This should be the same as the first face returned by lookAll.

Parameters:
x - the x value of the location being queried
y - the y value of the location being queried
Returns:
the face that should be drawn for the given location.

lookAll

public final java.util.List<ColoredChar> lookAll(Coordinate pos)
Returns every tile that is visible at a given location, ordered such that the tile with highest priority (the tile returned by look) is first, and the lowest priority is last. This last tile will be the face of the actual tile itself. Note that any actor which has a null face will not be included.

Parameters:
pos - the location being queried
Returns:
every tile that is visible at a given location

lookAll

public java.util.List<ColoredChar> lookAll(int x,
                                           int y)
Returns every tile that is visible at a given location, ordered such that the tile with highest priority (the tile returned by look) is first, and the lowest priority is last. This last tile will be the face of the actual tile itself. Note that any actor which has a null face will not be included.

Parameters:
x - the x value of the location being queried
y - the y value of the location being queried
Returns:
every tile that is visible at a given location

passableAt

public final boolean passableAt(Coordinate coord)
Returns true if the tile at the provided Coordinate is passable.

Parameters:
coord - the value of the position being queried
Returns:
true if the tile at the given Coordinate

passableAt

public boolean passableAt(int x,
                          int y)
Returns true if the tile at the provided (x, y) coordinates is passable.

Parameters:
x - the x value of the position being queried
y - the y value of the position being queried
Returns:
true if the tile at (x, y)

removeActor

public void removeActor(Actor actor)
Removes an Actor from the World. The Actor must be both bound to this World and not held by another Actor. However, if the Actor is expired, it may always be removed.

Parameters:
actor - the Actor to be removed

removeExpired

public void removeExpired()
Removes all expired Actor from the World.

setTile

public final void setTile(ColoredChar face,
                          boolean passable,
                          Coordinate coord)
Sets the face and passable value of the tile at the specified Coordinate.

Parameters:
face - the new face of the tile
passable - the new passable value of the tile
coord - the value of the position being updated

setTile

public void setTile(ColoredChar face,
                    boolean passable,
                    int x,
                    int y)
Sets the face and passable value of the tile at the specified (x, y) location.

Parameters:
face - the new face of the tile
passable - the new passable value of the tile
x - the x value of the position being updated
y - the y value of the position being updated

tick

public void tick()
Performs one tick. This will call act() on all Actor in the order specified by the act order of the World. Any Actor whose type does not appear in the act order does not act. Any expired Actor are removed from the World.

tileAt

public final ColoredChar tileAt(Coordinate coord)
Returns the face of the tile at the provided coordinates.

Parameters:
coord - the value of the position being queried
Returns:
the face of the tile at then given Coordinate

tileAt

public ColoredChar tileAt(int x,
                          int y)
Returns the face of the tile at the provided (x, y) coordinates.

Parameters:
x - the x value of the position being queried
y - the y value of the position being queried
Returns:
the face of the tile at (x, y)
